metadata.name: Aisha
metadata.description:
I'm Aisha,
I was raised in a home that stressed on a woman's purity & I was told to be a 'good girl'.

No one let me talk about my likes & desires.
Especially those of romantic or sexual ones. 
I was told “my body is my future husband's gift, 
so, losing my virginity will be like handing them
 a used, unwrapped gift.”
 
I didn't understand this concept, i still don't. 
It was & is important for me to understand that my body and my sexuality are a gift to myself before they can be a gift to anyone else.

My sexuality is my expression, 
my body is my home, my comfort zone.
It's all I have & where my soul & I hide, 
hiding away from this world.

I'm good, 
Just me,
This is me,
I'll be okay. 

-
Original Abstract & Figurative Artwork by Samosa Rani - Simran Wahan
